item.description:
Pierce and James provided the theoretical basis for Pragamatism, Holmes translated that theory into action, but Dewey is the philosopher to really work out the details and far reaching application of Pragmatism.


For our first meeting on John Dewey we will read the selection of works in Louis Menand's Pragmatism: A Reader (pages 182-270). These five essays and excerpts span the range of his career starting with his early "The Ethics of Democracy" (1888) to his late essay "I Beleive" (1939).
item.name: Skype Meeting: John Dewey I
